results.name: If n is odd, then a(n) = A065621(n). If n is even, then a(n) = n/2.
comment: A Collatz-like function: the difference is that for odd n the term 3n+1 is calculated without overflow, only using xor operations (n xor(2n+1)). It is known that for each argument the iterated function always ends up in a cycle which contains 1 (namely 1-2-1).
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8192
program: where odds [] = []; odds [x] = []; odds (_:x:xs) = x : odds xs
